works.description:
Hi Google Team,

This website http://www.gadgetland.in/ has been copying (scraping) most of our published contents for several months now located here: http://pinoytutorial.com/techtorial

As an example, you can search for the keyword "blackberry 9320 release date" and instead of our original post to appear on the top search: http://pinoytutorial.com/techtorial/blackberry-9320-curve-cheap-price-and-release-date-on-april/

The scraper site is the one outranking us. http://www.gadgetland.in/2012/03/03/blackberry-9320-curve-cheap-price-and-release-date-on-april/

The latest example can be found today, in which if you'll search this excerpt 

"Is Apple into luxury sea voyage now? No one can tell but everybody it seems, has a lot to tell about what project could French designer Philippe Starck be talking about when he grouped together such words as “Apple”, “Steve Jobs”, “secret” and “revolutionary” in a statement."

Aside from our original content located here: http://pinoytutorial.com/techtorial/philippe-starcks-apple-boat-project-might-be-revolutionary/

You can see the scraper site spawns a duplicate copy of our published content: http://www.gadgetland.in/2012/04/15/philippe-starck%E2%80%99s-apple-boat-project-might-be-revolutionary/
